info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 03 at 5:00PM EDT until May 03 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR HARRISON...SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTH CENTRAL BELMONT COUNTIES... At 500 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cadiz, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Cadiz, Wintersville, Tiltonsville, Hopedale, Flushing, Smithfield, Scio, Adena, Jewett, Dillonvale, Mount Pleasant, and Rayland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
